poem:
"Reflections on 'Good Grief'"

From gloss and gold comes not the shallow stream,
Levy's tale, in complex layers unfolds.
Seemingly gilded, yet beneath it teem,
A bittersweet life, its drama holds.
In the grown-up sphere, great truths we glean,
And so the dumber assumption scolds.
Therein the achingly handsome scene,
An adult mirror, our view remolds.
